metadata.title: CVE-2021-3760 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free vulnerability in theNFC stack can lead to a threat to confidentiality, integrity, and systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
